citation.article-title: Sediminibacillus halophilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic, Gram-positive bacterium from a hypersaline lake.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sediminibacillus (se.di′mi.ni.ba.cil′lus. L. n. sedimen -inis sediment; L. dim. masc. n. bacillus a small rod; N.L. masc. n. Sediminibacillus a rod living in sediment).
Cells are Gram-positive, rod-shaped and occur singly, in pairs or in short chains.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan type is A1γ with meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0 (Table 2). The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The genus belongs to the family Bacillaceae, being phylogenetically related to the genera Thalassobacillus and Halobacillus.
The type species is Sediminibacillus halophilus.
